events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection involving another vehicle, initiating the claim process.
After reviewing the initial details, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the nature of the car collision.
An experienced claim agent specializing in vehicle accident claims was assigned to manage and follow up on the customer's case.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer that the process was underway.
The agent requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and the accident statement.
The customer promptly submitted all requested documents, including the police report and detailed photos of the collision damage.
An investigation was initiated to verify the details of the auto accident, including investigating the other party’s insurance status.
The investigation confirmed the accident circumstances and validated the customer's claim eligibility for damage compensation.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs of the vehicle after assessment of the collision damage.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and thanked the agent for the smooth handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company following the customer's acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment covering the vehicle repairs was issued and transferred to the customer’s account promptly after claim approval.
With payment completed and no further issues outstanding, the insurance claim was officially closed to the customer’s satisfaction.
